text:
Hello. I would like to be able to search contacts based on a custom field using the API.
Is that possible?
The only search possible is via the "q" filter which seems like it only search on firstname, lastname, email and company name
Hello!  Using form global events, is there an event for when dependent fields propagate?  I only see these options <https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>
Hey <@UFM5653E1> that’s not something that we offer right now.  Can you tell me a bit more about how you’d use this and I can add your use case to our internal idea tracker?

<@ULGQ03PT9> we don’t have a global event for that. Would this be something where it’s the same field on every form or are there different dependent fields across the forms on your website. Any examples you have would help in communicating the PM about this and to come up with a work around in the meantime

Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>!  We have different dependent fields across the forms on our website.  We are currently localizing our fields using onFormReady, but this does not include dependent fields since it propagates after onFormReady

Gotcha, I think the closest you could get is to use the onFromReady to create listener that would get triggered when a dependent field propogates. That listener would be something like `$("myfieldselector").onChange(function(e){if ($("myfieldselector").val() == "valueICareAbout"){doSomeFunc()}})`
That’s just off the top of my head, but it will be something along those lines
I see.  I was thinking the same thing.  Just hoped there was more of built-in way of doing this.  Thanks for your help!
No problem, I’ll put this down internally but also feel free to post to <https://ideas.HubSpot.com>
